text: but you do see why `u' = LSTM(u)` with adaptive time stepping is undefined, right?

elements.text: with adaptive time stepping is undefined, right?

text: Because you don't know how many steps in advance?

elements.text: Because you don't know how many steps in advance?

text: the RHS is not constant. If you take different step sizes or reject a few, then you change the RHS. So the solution is dependent on the solver process and cannot be defined without referencing what solver was employed.

elements.text: the RHS is not constant. If you take different step sizes or reject a few, then you change the RHS. So the solution is dependent on the solver process and cannot be defined without referencing what solver was employed.

text: And changing the tolerance changes the solution as well. It doesn't converge to anything
